llm.feedback:
The draft repeats the same “Up” scenario twice and mixes DXY with UST10Y/S&P 500 language, violating the single‑asset focus. Replace the duplicate Up line with a distinct upside case that hinges on sticky CPI and dovish Fed tone (XTQIQRP5K) and a separate downside case that hinges on CPI easing and Fed cuts (3YAQ8JUPL). Drop all UST10Y and equity references; keep only DXY. Rewrite the four mover lines in the required format:  
**Up | 3‑6 mo | Sticky CPI & dovish Fed tone (XTQIQRP5K) | CPI Aug 12, Fed minutes (XTQIQRP5K) | 55%**  
**Up | 3‑6 mo | Expansion of tariff measures & war‑risk premium (F7K7Y35U5, XTQIQRP5K) | Tariff announcements, Ukraine comments (F7K7Y35U5, XTQIQRP5K) | 50%**  
**Down | 3‑6 mo | CPI easing & Fed cuts (3YAQ8JUPL, XTQIQRP5K) | CPI Aug 12, Fed policy meeting (3YAQ8JUPL, XTQIQRP5K) | 45%**  
**Down | 3‑6 mo | Tech earnings rebound lifting equity risk premium (FAN5RYW6T) | Q3 earnings, equity reaction (FAN5RYW6T) | 40%**  
Then craft a single swing‑trade line for DXY:  
**Up | 3‑6 mo | 96.5 → 97.5 (XTQIQRP5K) | Entry 96.8, Stop 96.2, Target 97.5, R/R 1:1.5 | Invalidation CPI < 2% & Fed cuts (3YAQ8JUPL) | Trigger CPI Aug 12 (3YAQ8JUPL) | 55% | 70**  
(If you prefer a downside trade, mirror the numbers with 96.5 → 95.5, entry 96.2, stop 96.8, target 95.5, R/R 1:1.5, invalidation CPI > 2% or tariff expansion, trigger CPI Aug 12, 45% probability, 60 confidence). Ensure every claim is cited, no extraneous assets appear, and the format matches the specification exactly.
